Seeking proposals for a comprehensive information technology audit for the Hazelwood School District (HSD).
The District has no obligation to reimburse responding firms for expenses incurred in preparing Proposals.
The District reserves the right to reject any or all Proposals and to waive informalities and minor irregularities.

If the proposal contains data the company doesn't want disclosed except for evaluation, the letter of transmittal must be marked with: 'Technical data contained on pages and______ in this Proposal furnished in connection with the Request for Proposal of the Hazelwood School District shall not be used nor disclosed except for evaluation purposes, provided that, if a Contract is awarded to this Company as a result of or in connection with the submission of this Proposal, Hazelwood School District shall have the right to use or disclose technical data to substantiate the award of a Contract.'
Proposals shall not contain any restrictive language different from the specified statement for technical data restriction.
The District assumes no liability for disclosure or use of unmarked technical data.
Proposals shall be limited to twelve (12) pages; not including the letter of transmittal, executive summary, attachments required by the District or personnel resumes.

Include a Letter of Transmittal providing an introduction to the Company and includes an expression of the Company’s ability and desire to meet the requirements of the RFP. The Letter of Transmittal should be under the signature of a Company officer.

Include an Executive Summary that briefly describes the Company’s approach to meeting the District’s requirements as outlined in the RFP, indicates any major requirements than cannot be met, and highlights the major features of the Proposal.
The executive summary must be no longer than three (3) pages.
Include names, titles and specific responsibilities of team members. Clearly indicate the Company’s prior experience in school district information technology audits, if applicable.
Give the address of the specific office which will have responsibility for performing the work.

List the qualifications of personnel by discipline presently employed, as of the date of this Proposal, at the office specified above. If personnel are qualified in several disciplines, list the personnel only once under their primary discipline. Clearly indicate prior experience in school district information technology audits, if applicable.
Through narrative discussion, show reason why the Company believes it is especially qualified
Proposals must be concise and organized.
Discuss unique qualifications that benefit the District in the execution of this project.

List recent examples of the Company’s school information technology audit experience during the last five (5) years. Include the name of school district, contact person, and phone number for each project.
Include references from other School Districts with name, address, and phone number of contact person. Only include references for projects completed in the past five (5) years.

Indicate whether the company has been the subject of any litigation through the discharge of its professional services. If so, provide a detailed description of the litigants, the subject matter, and the disposition of the arbitration or lawsuit.
Complete Attachment 1, “Company Identification Form.”

Complete Attachment 2, “References and Experience,” including a listing of all Missouri school districts for which the company has provided services. Include information on projects of a similar nature to that described in this RFP. Information on projects shall include the year the work was completed.
Firms must ﬁll out the Bid Pricing sheet.
Proposers are expected to indicate areas where the district's information technology could be assessed or improved through an audit process, including items not specified in 7.1 through 7.5.
Any additional items identified and their pricing, if not included elsewhere, should be indicated as separate line items on the pricing page.
Provide an introduction of your company, its history, and qualifications for the project.

item: Description of Data Acquisition Methods and Processes

item: Work Experience with School Districts and IT Audits
details: Describe work experience with school districts and information technology audits in the last five (5) years; provide contact names, phone numbers, and e-mail addresses of at least three (3) clients.

item: Description of Firm's Services and Benefits to the District
details: Briefly describe the services the firm provides and how those services will benefit the District.

item: Description of Data Required from the District
details: Describe data that will need to be provided by the District to assist in the analysis and projections.

item: Detailed Description of Audit Process and Methodology
details: Provide a detailed description of the audit process and methodology with data collection and analysis techniques.

item: Proposed Timeline for Completion of the Audit
details: Include a proposed timeline for completion of the audit.
